metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4283 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This security flaw occurs because theXkbCopyNames function left a dangling pointer to freed memory, resulting inout-of-bounds memory access on subsequent XkbGetKbdByName requests.. Thisissue can lead to local privileges elevation on systems where the X serveris running privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwardingsessions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xdmx-tools - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xnest - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xorg-server-source - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xserver-common - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xvfb - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xwayland - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5').
